title: 111_hr4780
content: The "Terrorist Notification Act of 2010" is cited as the short title. It amends the National Security Act of 1947 to provide intelligence related to members of the armed forces and civilian employees and contractors of the Department of Defense to the Department of Defense. The "Terrorist Notification Act of 2010" amends the National Security Act of 1947 to require the intelligence community to provide information indicating communication with individuals seeking to harm the United States to the Secretary of Defense, with exceptions for ongoing investigations. The "Terrorist Notification Act of 2010" amends the National Security Act of 1947 to require the intelligence community to provide information on individuals seeking to harm the United States to the Secretary of Defense, including members of the Armed Forces, civilian employees, and contractors. The Secretary of Defense must promptly respond to intelligence inquiries regarding members, civilian employees, and contractor personnel who have communicated with individuals seeking to harm the United States or its interests. The goal is to provide a response within 24 hours of receiving information from the intelligence community. The Secretary of Defense is required to notify the intelligence community about contacts of military personnel, civilian employees, or contractors with individuals seeking to harm the US. An annual review of the process is mandated, and consultation with military department Secretaries and Defense Agency heads is necessary. The Secretary of Defense must report annually to Congress on instances where the intelligence community has flagged contacts of military personnel, civilian employees, or contractors with individuals seeking to harm the US. Investigations into these instances must also be included in the report. The Secretary of Defense must report annually to Congress on flagged contacts of military personnel with individuals seeking to harm the US, as required by the National Security Act of 1947. The first report is due within one year of the Act's enactment, with a clerical amendment to the table of sections. Response to intelligence inquiries regarding members, civilian employees, and contractor personnel.
